title: VSCALEFPS — Scale Packed Float32 Values With Float32 Values

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VSCALEFPS xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VSCALEFPS ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VSCALEFPS zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst{er}`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Performs a floating-point scale of the packed single-precision floating-point values in the first source operand by multiplying it by 2 power of the float32 values in second source operand.

fields.value: Floor(zmm3) means maximum integer value ≤ zmm3.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: If the result cannot be represented in single precision, then the proper overflow response (for positive scaling operand), or the proper underflow response (for negative scaling operand) is issued. The overflow and underflow responses are dependent on the rounding mode (for IEEE-compliant rounding), as well as on other settings in MXCSR (exception mask bits, FTZ bit), and on the SAE bit.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.512 encoded version: The first source operand is a ZMM register. The second source operand is a ZMM register, a 512-bit memory location or a 512-bit vector broadcasted from a 32-bit memory location. The destination operand is a ZMM register conditionally updated with writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.256 encoded version: The first source operand is a YMM register. The second source operand is a YMM register, a 256-bit memory location, or a 256-bit vector broadcasted from a 32-bit memory location. The destination operand is a YMM register, conditionally updated using writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.128 encoded version: The first source operand is an XMM register. The second source operand is a XMM register, a 128-bit memory location, or a 128-bit vector broadcasted from a 32-bit memory location. The destination operand is a XMM register, conditionally updated using writemask k1.
